title: Extension of African American rights- description

content.description:
Emancipation

Fling out your banners, your honors be bringing,

Strike every chord and let music be ringing!

Celebrate freely this day of all days.

Few are the years since that notable blessing,

Raised you from slaves to the powers of men.

Each year has seen you my brothers progressing,

Never to sink to that level again....

Press boldly forward nor waver, nor falter.

Blood has been freely poured out in your cause,

Lives sacrificed upon Liberty’s altar.

Press to the front, it were craven to pause....

Up! Men and brothers, be noble, be earnest!

Ripe is the time and success is assured;

Know that your fate was the hardest and sternest

When through those lash-ringing days you endured.

Never again shall the manacles1 gall2 you

Never again shall the whip stroke defame!

Nobles and Freemen, your destinies call you

Onward to honor, to glory and fame.

Source: Paul Laurence Dunbar, 1890

1:chains or shackles↩

2:to irritate↩
content.question: Which of the following best describes a way that African Americans continued efforts to extend rights and liberties in the twentieth century?

choices.label: Artists and writers of the New Negro movement adapted European norms in their work.
The Freedmen’s Bureau was established to help formerly enslaved people transition to citizenship.
Civil rights groups organized the March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom.
Millions of African American families relocated to northern and western states during the Great Migration.

content.answer: Civil rights groups organized the March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom.
